page.title: 03EDUCATION IN MALVERN WELLS
page.content: Four education establishments exist in the area. 3 residential independent schools and l maintained day school. The{Abbey International College}- established in l978 on the site of a former girls school - prepares l00 overseas students for further education in the UK and has summer schools for 300.{Evendine Court founded in l886 has 80 girls from l6 to l8. The l year course specialises in cookery and secretarial skills. {Wells House}prep school has 70 boys and 30 girls from 7 to l3 in a building formerly a hydropath.{Malvern {Wells C of E Primary}school has 70 children from 5 to ll who go on to the comprehensive schools in Malvern and Hanley Castle. School and youth groups use Linden Manor (HQ of{Colony {Holidays)}and Perrycroft{(Birmingham {Boys Brigade)}as residential centres.
